page.title: 03THE LION FARM ESTATE OLDBURY
page.content: This council estate was built in the 1960's on land reclaimed from old mine workings. The estate is planned around a central crossroads, where most of the amenities can be found. The church, primary school, health centre, public library, public house and a parade of shops are all situated within this central area. In addition, there is an Old People's Home opposite the school. There are several tower blocks of flats, but also many maisonettes and 'town houses'. As the estate is well defined by main boundary roads it forms quite a close knit community. A Lion Farm Festival has been held for the first time in 1985, involving sporting and cultural activities. In the church hall various clubs and societies such as cub scouts meet.
